Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Those children from Burckhalter Elementary School in Oakland were thrilled to have such a special field trip to Stanford Golf Course.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: part of a pilot tutoring program through the Currys’ foundation

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Wade, an 8-year-old in third grade, said she would remember this day golfing with Curry “for 15 years,” and that her favorite part of the visit was “everything.”
Unnamed Group of People.Name of Source: elementary-school students (specifically LeAni Wade and Terrell Covington)
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: part of a pilot tutoring program through the Currys’ foundation; participants in a field trip to Stanford Golf Course

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Everything happens for a reason and the journey gives you all type of different experiences along the way,”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Golden State Warriors player; recently won an Olympic gold medal

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “But this summer’s been amazing, just coming off a tough NBA year to experience what we did and get a win in the Olympics and some of the things I look forward to every year especially around our foundation and the work that we’re doing here in Oakland. ... It puts everything into perspective of what basketball has done for me and the doors that it’s opened and trying to take full advantage of it.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Golden State Warriors player; recently won an Olympic gold medal; founder of Eat.Learn.Play. Foundation

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “It’s the same way I appreciate all the things I get to do on and off the court where it’s all connected,”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Golden State Warriors player; founder of Eat.Learn.Play. Foundation

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Me having fun going and winning a gold medal raised the platform to then be able to talk about stuff that matters even more. Being able to share those experiences with my family, the (foundation) team, they know especially while they were working tirelessly every day to make sure a day like today is executed and make sure our plan is locked in, I’m representing everybody out there on the court doing what I do.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Golden State Warriors player; founder of Eat.Learn.Play. Foundation
Golden State Warriors player; trademarking “nuit, nuit” catchphrase

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “What’s interesting is it’s never been a one and done and we’ve always slow rolled things out because we love to build a model that kind of proves itself and can stand on its own,”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Co-founder of Eat.Learn.Play. Foundation; Stephen Curry's wife

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The Currys announced Thursday a commitment to raise and invest $25 million over the next five years devoted to literacy programs that will provide one-on-one tutoring for children who are at least two grade levels behind in reading.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Foundation founded by Stephen and Ayesha Curry; focus on Oakland schools

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: These students have been part of a pilot tutoring program through the Currys’ foundation that is again expanding its reach in Oakland Unified School District after efforts last year included the revitalization of six schoolyards.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Partner of Eat.Learn.Play. Foundation for tutoring programs and schoolyard revitalization
